metadata.title: CVE-2013-3239 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
phpMyAdmin 3.5.x before 3.5.8 and 4.x before 4.0.0-rc3, when a SaveDirdirectory is configured, allows remote authenticated users to executearbitrary code by using a double extension in the filename of an exportfile, leading to interpretation of this file as an executable file by theApache HTTP Server, as demonstrated by a .php.sql filename.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:3.5.8.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:3.5.8.1-1').
